alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 5:44PM AKST until January 18 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Wind chills to 40 below. * WHERE...Near the Bering Strait. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow are causing low visibility. Large snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds combined with snow and blowing snow are causing low visibility from the Bering Strait to Teller. These conditions are expected to continue tonight, then improve after early Wednesday morning as winds decrease. Conditions are much less severe at St Lawrence Island.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
